thread.title: Mollie Bylett gets paid to travel the world for GoPro and BooHoo.com
thread.title_full: Mollie Bylett gets paid to travel the world for GoPro and BooHoo.com | Daily Mail Online

author: Georgia Diebelius For Mailonline
title: Mollie Bylett gets paid to travel the world for GoPro and BooHoo.com
text:
9 shares 6
View
comments
It's what every millennial dreams of.
Leaving her London home two years ago, Mollie Bylett ditched the traditional route into full-time work by opting instead to travel the world - and gets paid to do so.
After finishing her A-Levels, the 21-year-old started blogging to keep friends and family updated on her adventures - whether it was bungee jumping in Queenstown, New Zealand, or swimming with turtles on the East Coast of Australia.
Scroll down for video
Mollie recently returned from Croatia, where she joined The Yacht Week to help with content promotion
Unexpectedly the blog , which Mollie launched at aged 19 while backpacking around South East Asia, took off and over the last five months the aspiring singer has teamed up with a number of brands such as GoPro, New Look and online website BooHoo.
RELATED ARTICLES Previous 1 Next Could YOU travel the world on £7 a day? An ex-stockbroker... Now TRAINS have introduced charges for passengers with... From intertwined beech branches in Northern Ireland to... No Instagram... but they still had a good time! Vintage... Not for the faint-hearted! The devilish obstacle course in... Beautiful decay: Photographer travelled Europe for 15 years... Share this article Share Since working full-time on the blog Mollie has jetted off on an all expenses paid holidays and glamorous press trips twice a month.
So far she has visited New Zealand, Australia, Indonesia, Greece, Amsterdam, Poland, Dublin, Barcelona and Portugal - and her instagram page has more than 18,000 followers.

Mollie said: 'I can’t imagine a life without travel now, and I just hope that I can continue to pursue that dream' (pictured in Australia)
Look out below: Mollie braved bungee jumping in Queenstown, New Zealand, during her travels around the country
The bike capital: Mollie also travelled around Europe, stopping in Amsterdam along the way with her GoPro and selfie stick
She recently returned from Croatia, where she joined The Yacht Week to help with content promotion.
Mollie said: 'My blog began purely to document my adventures for friends and family - I had no idea you could earn from it I’ve just always loved keeping memories.
'For the first year-and-a half my blog was purely a hobby alongside my life - lots of hard work and no pay cheque whatsoever.
'For the first year-and-a-half my blog was purely a hobby alongside my life,' the 21-year-old said (pictured on the East Coast of Australia)
'I spoke to other bloggers and speakers and realised there was a career to be had in it,' (above, Mollie stopped off at Sydney Opera House)
Mollie now gets paid to travel the world and blog as well as representing brands including GoPro, New Look and BooHoo
'But when you love something you don’t even question it. I figured that even if nothing came of it - I’d have a scrapbook of memories and adventures online.
'When I got home from my travels, I noticed my traffic was increasing and I started to get blogger event invites.
'I spoke to other bloggers and speakers and realised there was a career to be had in it.
Since working full-time on the blog she has jetted off on holidays and fancy press trips. (She is pictured at the Entourage premiere in Leicester Square, London)
Mollie started blogging to keep friends and family updated while backpacking around South East Asia (pictured in Thailand)
Blonde bombshell Bylett is getting paid to live the life every millennial dreams of (celebrating Christmas while travelling in Australia)
'I’ve juggled working on my blog every day, with a part-time beauty business and my singing career.
'It’s only in the last six months I’ve got to a stage where I receive paid projects and commissions through my blog.
'Eventually the hard work starts paying off.'
In July Mollie was approached by GoPro for a product launch in Austria.
She added: 'We were equipped with the latest cameras and our mission was simply to have a good time and record it.
Unexpectedly the blog took off and over the last five months the aspiring singer has gained thousands of followers (Kefalonia, above)
'I want to inspire people to do the same and take that leap of faith in booking their first plane ticket' (Mollie pictured in Croatia)
'Travelling opened up my eyes to a lot of things and it continuously changes me and helps me grow into a better person' (above, Greece)
'It was a pretty epic opportunity. It’s like a dream.
'Travelling opened up my eyes to a lot of things and it continuously changes me and helps me grow into a better person.
'I can’t imagine a life without travel now, and I just hope that I can continue to pursue that dream.
'I want to inspire people to do the same and take that leap of faith in booking their first plane ticket.
'It can be hard to take a risk, or quit a job or lifestyle that you have become complacent in.
'But if you aren’t happy, do something about it. And that’s what I hope to encourage.'
'It can be hard to take a risk, or quit a job or lifestyle that you have become complacent in - but if you aren’t happy, do something about it'
Read more: Mollie Bylett | My Lifestyle, Travel + Personal Blog
